months.name: Mirabilis
months.tagline: Beyond the boundary of time, in the hush between cycles, Mirabilis blooms. Here, two sacred breaths‚Äîone of fire, one of shadow‚Äîmeet where neither past nor future holds sway.

months.name: Nivis
months.tagline: From the Latin ‚Äònix‚Äô meaning snow, Nivis is the breath of winter‚Äôs hush, a month where frost writes poetry upon the earth and silence speaks in crystalline whispers.

months.name: Janus
months.tagline: Named for the two-faced Roman god of doorways and transitions, Janus stands at the threshold of past and future, where winds of change stir the soul.

months.name: Brigid
months.tagline: Named for the Celtic goddess of poetry, hearth, and forge, Brigid is the sacred fire of renewal and inspiration, where winter‚Äôs chill yields to the first flickers of spring.

months.name: Flora
months.tagline: A tribute to the Roman goddess of blooming flowers and spring‚Äôs gentle embrace, Flora is the time when earth awakens in colour, a festival of fragrant renewal.

months.name: Maia
months.tagline: Named for the nurturing Roman goddess of growth, Maia embodies the ripening warmth of spring, her name echoing ‚Äòmaius‚Äô‚Äîgreater, larger, the promise of abundance.

months.name: Juno
months.tagline: Honouring the Roman goddess of love and sovereignty, Juno is a month of passion and protection, where devotion burns bright and the sacred feminine reigns supreme.

months.name: Solis
months.tagline: From the Latin ‚Äòsol‚Äô meaning sun, Solis is the golden hour of the year, when the sun stands proud at its peak, bestowing light, life, and radiant joy.

months.name: Terra
months.tagline: Honouring the Roman goddess of the Earth, Terra is a celebration of fertile lands and fruitful harvests, where nature‚Äôs generosity spills forth in green abundance.

months.name: Lugh
months.tagline: Named for the Celtic god of light, skill, and craftsmanship, Lugh is a forge of inspiration, where wisdom and fire unite to shape the fate of heroes.

months.name: Pomona
months.tagline: A tribute to the Roman goddess of orchards and fruitfulness, Pomona is a season of rich harvests and whispered abundance, where the earth gifts its sweetest treasures.

months.name: Autumna
months.tagline: From the Latin ‚Äòautumnus‚Äô meaning the fall, Autumna is the golden descent of the year, where leaves turn to fire and the air hums with the poetry of endings.

months.name: Eira
months.tagline: From the Old Norse ‚Äòeyrr‚Äô and Welsh ‚Äòeira‚Äô meaning snow, Eira is the quiet descent of winter‚Äôs veil, where frost-kissed dreams whisper of endings and renewal.

months.name: Aether
months.tagline: The celestial breath between earth and sky, Aether is the unseen force of existence, where stardust and spirit intertwine in the spaces between worlds.

special_days.name: Imbolc
special_days.description: Imbolc marks the first signs of spring. It's a time to celebrate the return of life and the arrival of new growth.
special_days.poem:
Imbolc‚Äôs fire, a guiding light,
To cleanse the old and spark the bright.
Sweep the hearth and set your aim,
Begin anew in Brigid‚Äôs name.

special_days.name: Ostara
special_days.description: Ostara marks the spring equinox. It's a time to celebrate the balance of light and dark and to look ahead to the growth and renewal of spring.
special_days.poem:
Ostara greets the dawn‚Äôs bright glow,
As light and dark share equal show.
Plant a seed and watch it grow,
Spring awakens, soft and slow.

special_days.name: Beltane
special_days.description: Beltane marks the beginning of summer. It's a time to celebrate the fertility of the earth and the arrival of new life.
special_days.poem:
Beltane fires in moonlit glade,
Mark love‚Äôs embrace and life displayed.
Dance with joy ‚Äòneath skies so wide,
And weave the threads where dreams reside.

special_days.name: Litha
special_days.description: Litha marks the summer solstice. It's a time to celebrate the power of the sun and the longest day of the year.
special_days.poem:
The sun at peak, its golden flame,
On Litha‚Äôs day, no dark can claim.
Bathe in light, embrace its glow,
And let your inner fire grow.

special_days.name: Lammas
special_days.description: Lammas marks the beginning of the harvest season. It's a time to give thanks for the abundance of the earth and to prepare for the coming winter.
special_days.poem:
Lammas fields of amber grain,
Give thanks for sun and summer rain.
Share your bread, your heart, your care,
And bless the earth with all you bear.

special_days.name: Mabon
special_days.description: Mabon marks the autumn equinox. It's a time to celebrate the balance of light and dark and to look ahead to the chill of winter.
special_days.poem:
Mabon‚Äôs time, the scales now sway,
Equal hours of night and day.
Gather fruits and share the feast,
Celebrate the earth‚Äôs increase.

special_days.name: Samhain
special_days.description: This festival marks the end of the harvest season. It's a time to reflect on the past year and honour the ancestors who have come before us.
special_days.poem:
The veil grows thin on Samhain night,
A time for dreams and spirit‚Äôs sight.
Light a flame for those once near,
And seek their wisdom, calm and clear.

special_days.name: Yule
special_days.description: Yule marks the winter solstice. It's a time to celebrate the return of the light and the rebirth of the sun.
special_days.poem:
Yule‚Äôs bright star in longest night,
Brings hope of dawn and coming light.
Exchange your gifts, sing songs of cheer,
The wheel has turned; new life draws near.

special_days.name: Mirabilis
special_days.description: Mirabilis is a breath held between endings and beginnings‚Äîa sacred pause where the wheel stands still. Neither dark nor light, it is the hush between heartbeats, the silence where soul meets sky.
special_days.poem:
Between the dusk and coming light,
Mirabilis blooms in velvet night.
No path to walk, no time to chase,
Just stars and stillness, vast in space.

national_holidays.title: New Year's Day
national_holidays.description: A turning of the cosmic wheel, where time is reborn in shimmering hope and stardust wishes.

national_holidays.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
national_holidays.description: A day of dreaming bold and rising strong, when voices echo like thunder for justice and peace.

national_holidays.title: Valentine's Day
national_holidays.description: A heart-shaped spell cast upon the world, where love blooms and passion lingers like rose perfume.

national_holidays.title: Presidents‚Äô Day
national_holidays.description: A reflection on those who shaped the nation's fate‚Äîthrough storms and stillness, with quill and courage.

national_holidays.title: St. Patrick's Day
national_holidays.description: Emerald echoes and laughter rise‚Äîtoday the fae walk among us, cloaked in clover and mirth.

national_holidays.title: Memorial Day
national_holidays.description: A solemn flame flickers for the fallen‚Äîwhere silence speaks of sacrifice and honour rides the breeze.

national_holidays.title: Mother's Day
national_holidays.description: A day wrapped in the soft glow of nurturing spirits, where love flows from root to bloom.

national_holidays.title: Father's Day
national_holidays.description: A tribute to guiding stars‚Äîstrong, steady, and luminous as ancient oaks in summer‚Äôs sun.

national_holidays.title: Juneteenth
national_holidays.description: Chains shattered, spirits freed‚ÄîJuneteenth rings with ancestral triumph and the fire of freedom.

national_holidays.title: Independence Day
national_holidays.description: Fireworks bloom like celestial flowers in celebration of liberty‚Äôs blazing star.

national_holidays.title: Labor Day
national_holidays.description: A sacred pause where hands rest and hearts honour the quiet nobility of work.

national_holidays.title: Columbus Day
national_holidays.description: Voyages remembered beneath a questioning sky‚Äîechoes of discovery and reckoning alike.

national_holidays.title: Veterans Day
national_holidays.description: Honour walks among us, cloaked in silence and strength‚Äîtoday we remember the keepers of peace.

national_holidays.title: Thanksgiving Day
national_holidays.description: A harvest of gratitude, where hearths glow with remembrance and blessings flow like mead.

national_holidays.title: Christmas Day
national_holidays.description: A holy hush cloaks the world in wonder, where light returns through stories, stars, and song.

custom_events.title: Hello World, Baby Baby!
custom_events.notes: You took too much, too much....

zodiac.name: Birch
zodiac.mythical_creature: White Hart - Purity, power, and nobility.

zodiac.name: Rowan
zodiac.animal: Crane - Longevity, wisdom, and spiritual strength.
zodiac.mythical_creature: Dragon - Transformation, growth, and new beginnings.

zodiac.name: Ash
zodiac.mythical_creature: Sea Serpent - Hidden depths and transformation.

zodiac.name: Willow
zodiac.mythical_creature: Hare - Magic, fertility, and new life.

zodiac.name: Hawthorn
zodiac.mythical_creature: Unicorn - Purity, grace, and divine guidance.

zodiac.name: Oak
zodiac.mythical_creature: White Horse - Power, freedom, and victory.

zodiac.name: Hazel
zodiac.mythical_creature: Salmon of Knowledge - Quest for wisdom and understanding.

zodiac.name: Ivy
zodiac.mythical_creature: Faerie - Magic and the hidden realms of nature.
